intro: Trochomeria garcinii, commonly known as the African starflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
